publications.title: Trustworthy scientific inference for inverse problems with generative models
publications.abstract: We present a novel framework for performing trustworthy scientific inference when using generative models to solve inverse problems. By combining uncertainty quantification with interpretable model diagnostics, our approach enables researchers to assess the reliability of their inferences and identify potential failure modes before drawing scientific conclusions.

dynesty: a dynamic nested sampling package for estimating Bayesian posteriors and evidences
publications.journal: Monthly Notices of the Royal Astronomical Society
publications.abstract: We introduce dynesty, a pure-Python package for estimating Bayesian posteriors and evidences (marginal likelihoods) using Dynamic Nested Sampling. By adaptively allocating samples based on posterior structure, dynesty can estimate challenging posteriors using substantially fewer likelihood calls than traditional approaches, while also providing reliable error estimates on evidence calculations crucial for Bayesian model comparison.
